farSections.parsed_f_deliveries_performance:
# Deliveries or Performance

Four of the bleacher seating systems shall be delivered to 218 McWilliams Rd, JBSA Camp Bullis, TX 78257; and four of the bleacher seating systems shall be delivered to 1350 Scott Drive, JBSA Lackland, TX 78236.

The delivery schedule for the line items is as follows:

- Line Item 0001: 8 units to be delivered by 30 September 2025.
- Line Item 0002: 8 units to be delivered by 30 September 2025.
- Line Item 0003: 8 units to be delivered by 30 September 2025.

All shipments are to be sent to the following address:

343 TRS DORR AF BPN NO MILSBILLS PROCESSES
1325 Harmon Dr
Lackland AFB, TX 78236-5438
United States

Point of Contact:
Detra Whitfield
Email: detra.whitfield@us.af.mil
Telephone: 210-671-6177

The deliveries are FOB Destination with the contractor responsible for delivery to the specified locations.

## FAR Clauses Incorporated by Reference

- 52.242-15 Stop-Work Order, Effective August 1989
- 52.247-34 F.o.b. Destination, Effective November 1991

farSections.parsed_h_special_contract_requirements: To be eligible for award, registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) must be current. This includes legacy registrations from the On-line Registration and Certifications Application (ORCA) and Central Contractor Registration (CCR). To register or update former CCR and Reps & Certs that are not current, go to https://www.sam.gov and provide the mandatory information.
farSections.parsed_i_contract_clauses:
# Contract Clauses

## Addenda to FAR Clauses

### ADDENDUM TO 52.212-1 INSTRUCTIONS TO OFFERORS--COMMERCIAL ITEMS (Sep 2023)
- Deletions: Multiple Offers (52.212-1(e)), Multiple Awards (52.212-1(h)), Product Samples (52.212-1(d)) are deleted in entirety.
- Tailoring of 52.212-1(g) Contract Award: 
  - Period for Acceptance of Offer (52.212-1(c)) is tailored to require offerors to hold prices firm for 90 calendar days from receipt of offer date.
- Proposal Preparation Instructions: Government intends to evaluate offers and award without interchanges; initial offer should be best terms price and technical; Government reserves right to conduct interchanges if necessary; may reject any/all offers, accept other than lowest, waive informalities.

[Content includes extensive contract clauses and requirements]

farSections.parsed_m_evaluation_factors:
# Evaluation Factors for Award

## FAR Clauses Incorporated by Full Text

**52.212-2 Evaluation-Commercial Products and Commercial Services. (Nov 2021)**

As prescribed in 12.301(c), the Contracting Officer may insert a provision substantially as follows:

Evaluation-Commercial Products and Commercial Services (Nov 2021)

(a) The Government will award a firm-fixed priced contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The following shall be used to evaluate offers:

**Lowest Price Technically Acceptable**

Refer to Addendum 52.212-2 of this document.
